Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Debug Error

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\parts\debug\electron-browser\debug.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "debugErrorEditor"

Query:
Is Debug a verb or a noun   CnE_Developer_Moravia_ITA1@hotmail.com  9/27/2016 12:42:23 PM

data.title: can't have two files with the same name open at the same time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: ubuntu 14

A lot of types of software projects require having specially named files (CMakeLists.txt, etc) which appear in multiple places within the project but have the same name. Unfortunately, vscode seems to treat them all as if they are the same file, only allowing one instance to be open at a time. This is _very_ confusing, as you can accidentally, and very subtly, change the file you are editing from the one you thought it was. Code should use the path of files to disambiguate them, and allow having multiple files of the same name open at the same time.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create two files with the same name, but different paths
2. try to have them both open, and fail

data.title: Environment variables in cmd different than in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type `echo %ProgramFiles%` in cmd -> `C:\Program Files`
2. type `echo %ProgramFiles%` in integrated terminal -> `C:\Program Files (x86)`

Why do the two commands not yield the same result?

data.title: Horizontal lines break hover a little
data.body:
We now render horizontal lines between each array element a hover is made of. Strictly speaking that's not correct and provides no good separation between elements from provider A and provider B and the elements a single provider created. The below gif shows how the css-selector hover appears  now. IMO we should only render the separator lines for markdown that came from a different source.

![sep-27-2016 16-26-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/18877954/34cc7cd2-84cf-11e6-8892-973d101f6a0d.gif)

data.title: Colon cancels completion
vscode shows 'not responding' alert when opening a context menu and waiting
data.body:
I'm not even sure if this is even worth fixing as I've **never** seen this during normal usage.
I found out about it when I was thinking about adding an action to a context menu and staring at it for a while. Vscode will show an alert about 30 seconds in about the window not responding when it is in fact still fine.
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10-14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any project.
2. Right click on any file.
3. Wait.

Here's a video: https://docs.google.com/uc?id=0B3gaEinIV1dCeEZVaEdzMG9vVnc (skip to :30)

data.title: Questionable implementation of getProcessId
Some unknown extension causes backspace to no longer works in json files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I installed a bunch of extensions, excluding vim/emacs ones which I know mess up the keyboard.

Bug: Backspace and tab keys no longer works in json files (other file type seem to work). I can't tell which extension is causing this. I looked at the Contributions and I didn't see backspace being overridden. If you can provide an easier way to find out which extension is causing this problem that would be great.

Bug#2: Also, auto-complete no longer works in settings.json...could be a different root cause.

data.title: Error: IPC channel is already disconnected
data.body:
Testing #12595

Closing a terminal with the trashcan icon I get this in the console:

```
index.js:26 Error: IPC channel is already disconnected
    at ChildProcess.target.disconnect (internal/child_process.js:680)
    at Pipe.channel.onread (internal/child_process.js:465)onError @ index.js:26(anonymous function) @ index.js:90emitOne @ events.js:96emit @ events.js:188window.onerror @ C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\electron.asar\renderer\init.js:114n.globals.onerror @ errorTelemetry.ts:64
events.js:160 Uncaught Error: IPC channel is already disconnected
```

data.title: Infinite loop saved modified
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Install EditorConfig for VSCode version 0.3.3
2. add a .editorconfig file with
   # Editor configuration, see http://editorconfig.org
   root = true

[*]
charset = utf-8
indent_style = space
indent_size = 2
end_of_line = lf
insert_final_newline = true
trim_trailing_whitespace = true

[*.md]
max_line_length = 0
trim_trailing_whitespace = false
1. Create a html file with no final_newline
2. Then save it

Result: the file loop between save and modified [adding final new line].

data.title: Inability to uninstall extensions (some(times))
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T12:46:15.113Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `"extensions.autoUpdate": false,`
2. Uninstall some extensions (in this example REST Client)
3. Restart
4. You get this in extensions view:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18875485/097de286-8494-11e6-98c6-963d866fddfc.png)
5. Uninstall again and restart
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18875492/1171b9a4-8494-11e6-8cf7-bf498dcea505.png)
6. Back to:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18875502/1aa5b7e6-8494-11e6-956a-cc30384fb0db.png)
7. Go to step 5

data.title: 'Toggle control characters' - not specific enough
data.body:
Maybe rename it to 'Toggle indentation control'
Toggle control characters is not very clear as to what it does

![screen shot 2016-09-27 at 15 20 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/18875522/6e4938e6-84c6-11e6-8673-779c26c07786.png)

data.title: extensions.autoUpdate makes uninstalling extension impossible
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (f62883f07422cae4b53c2a185b105091460a0a85, 2016-09-27T12:46:15.113Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `extensions.autoUpdate: true`
2. Uninstall extensions

you will get:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18875135/6f23e772-8492-11e6-9e5d-c9a487de4584.png)
1. Restart Now (to deactivate)

You can see that extensions just got auto installed
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18875153/89466a58-8492-11e6-8ec5-04fc9c1c2b54.png)

If you are fast enough you will see green button with (Installing...) after that restart to deactivate

data.title: xml tag auto completion produces malformed tag
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:
1. press < vs-code weill generate <>
2. enter name of tag i.e <case>
3. double press tab to auto complete
4. vs-code generates `<case><case>>` instead of `<case><case>` That is one to many '>' at the end

data.title: No bracket matching and auto indent in CSS (HTML, Handlebars)
data.body:
Testing #12100

Have a style block with some CSS in either a HTML or Handlebars file. Notice that:
- bracket matching does not work
- auto indent does not work

Since this works in CSHTML, I wonder if this is something easy to configure?

Marking important because I think this is a very common thing to do for our users.

@alexandrudima fyi since @aeschli is out

data.title: Show the user the list of extensions that will be installed
data.body:
Testing #12647

When I install an extension pack I get asked whether I want in stall the dependent extensions. Unless there is documentation in the README I don't know what these dependent extensions are.

Simliar to the 'contributions' tab I'd like to see a 'list of extensions' that I will get when I install an extension pack.

data.title: Debuging es6 Proxy as property -> Internal error: illegal access
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1 - If I, in node.js 6.6, write (resp. have transpiled from TypeScript) a class like that:

```
 class Table {
    constructor(args) {
         this._rows = new Proxy({ test: 42 }, {});
    }
 }
```

2 - And then instantiate it like this:

`var table = new Table();`

3 - When I debug in Visual Studio Code and I want to watch the var table I always have 

> Internal error: illegal access

written there, meaning I can not watch table or any of its properties.

The same thing works perfectly fine in Chrome.

I have raised this on Stackoverflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39710014/debuging-es6-proxy-as-property-internal-error-illegal-access

data.title: Parsing lots of files asynchronously and in parallel seems to be freezing my extension and VS Code to death. Looking for some help
